title: Llynnau Mymbyr Walking Route

images.title: rob / Llynnau  Mymbyr, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The east end of Llynnau Mymbyr with Plas y Brenin (PYB) National Mountain Centre in the background.

images.title: Eric Jones / Llynnau Mymbyr, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Llynnau Mymbyr on a cold and overcast August day, with the Snowdon Horseshoe in the background

images.title: Terry Hughes / Llynnau Mymbyr from Moorland Heather, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The lake from Moorland Heather. This Southwesterly view of Llynnau Mymbyr was taken from surrounding heather above Llyn y Coryn.

images.title: David Gill / Llynnau Mymbyr, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking ESE across the lake from the footbridge, with Yr Wyddfa (Snowdon) in the distance

images.title: Eirian Evans / Llynnau Mymbyr, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The eastern lake, looking towards Plas y Brenin, the outdoor activities centre.

images.title: Eric Jones / Kayaking on Llynnau Mymbyr, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Kayaking on Llynnau Mymbyr. Students from the adjacent Plas y Brenin National Mountain Centre kayaking at the eastern end of Llynnau Mymbyr. The summit beyond Coed Bryn Engan (part of the Gwydyr Forest) is Moel Siabod.

images.title: Eirian Evans / Llynnau Mymbyr, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The western lake can just be made out beyond the strip of land which nearly cuts it off. Snowdon is behind the cloud on the right.

images.title: Graham Horn / Llynnau Mymbyr, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Seen from the south bank of Afon Llugwy where it exits the more eastrly of the two llyns, just above Plas y Brenin. A footbridge crosses here.

description: Enjoy a short walk along this picturesque lake in the Dyffryn Mymbyr valley area of the Snowdonia National Park. The walk starts from the car park at Capel Curig and follows a track to the lake. There are footpaths on either side of the lake with the ones on the southern side passing the woodland of Coed Bryn-Engan. There are lovely views across the water to the surrounding mountains. It is a particularly good spot to get a photo of the Snowdon Horseshoe across the water. If you'd like to continue your walking in the area then you could climb to Moel Siabod or visit the nearby Llyn Cowlyd .
